comment.shortText: The web actions that are available in this debugger.

tags.text: ^web\.
WebActions

comment.shortText:
Registers or updates a pause trigger with this debugger.
Pause triggers can be used to tell the debugger when you want it to stop execution.
You specify the bot, tag, line and column numbers and the debugger will stop before/after it executes the code at that location.

tags.text: setPauseTrigger
debug.setPauseTrigger-botOrId

comment.shortText: the bot, or bot ID that should be registered.
the name of the tag that the trigger should be set on.
The options that go with this pause trigger.
Registers or updates a pause trigger with a debugger. Returns the newly created trigger.
comment.text:
Pause triggers can be used to tell the debugger where you want it to temporarily stop execution. You specify the bot, tag, line and column numbers, and the debugger will stop before it executes the code at that location.
Additionally, the debugger will call all handlers that have been registered with debug.onPause.

tags.text: setPauseTrigger
debug.setPauseTrigger-trigger

comment.shortText: The trigger that should be registered or updated.
Changes the state that the given bot is in.
The bot to change.
The state that the bot should move to.
The group of states that the bot's state should change in. (Defaults to "state")
Creates a new bot and returns it.
The mods which specify the new bot's tag values. If given a mod with no tags, then an error will be thrown.
Destroys the given bot, bot ID, or list of bots.
The bot, bot ID, or list of bots to destroy.

Disables the given pause trigger.
Disabled pause triggers will continue to be listed with debug.listPauseTriggers, but will not cause a pause to happen while they are disabled.
The trigger or trigger ID that should be disabled.
Enables the given pause trigger
The trigger or trigger ID that should be enabled.

Gets the list of action objects that have been performed by bots in the current debugger.
Action objects are used by CasualOS to represent changes to bots or external effects that should be performed.
Examples of this are [`create(...mods)`](ref:create), [`os.toast(message, duration)`](ref:os.toast) and [`os.enableVR(options)`](ref:os.enableVR).

Gets the list of bot actions that have been performed by bots in the current debugger.
Action objects are used by CasualOS to represent changes to bots or external effects that should be performed.
Bot actions are actions that immediately change bots or bot tags or masks.
comment.text: Examples of bot actions are [`create(...mods)`](ref:create), [`destroy(bot)`](ref:destroy) or [`setTagMask(bot, tag, value, space)`](ref:setTagMask).

comment.shortText: Gets the current call stack for the debugger. Call stacks are useful for determining program flow and how scripts interact with each other.

Gets the list of common action objects that have been performed by bots in the current debugger. Action objects are used by CasualOS to represent changes to bots or external effects that should be performed.
Common actions are actions that do not immediately change bots or bot tags or masks.
comment.text: Examples of common actions are [`os.toast(message, duration)`](ref:os.toast) and [`os.enableVR(options)`](ref:os.enableVR).

comment.shortText: Gets the list of errors that have occurred in the current debugger. Errors occur when an exceptional event happens in a script and prevents the rest of the script from executing.
comment.text: Debuggers capture these errors and let you inspect them afterwards.

comment.shortText: Gets the list of portal bots in the debugger.
Gets a list of common trigger locations for the specified tag on the specified bot. Returns an array containing the list of possible pause trigger locations.
the bot or bot ID that the locations should be listed for.
the name of the tag that the locations should be listed for.
Gets the list of pause triggers that have been registered with this debugger.

tags.text: listPauseTriggers
debug.listPauseTriggers

comment.shortText: Registers the given handler to be called after a bot action is executed in this debugger.
The handler that should be called.
Registers the given handler function to be called after any tag is updated in the debugger.
the function that should be called when a tag is updated.
Registers the given handler function to be called after any tag mask is updated in the debugger.
the function that should be called when a tag mask is updated.
Registers the given handler to be called before a bot action is executed in this debugger.
The handler that should be called.
Registers the given handler function to be called before a user action is performed in the debugger.
comment.text:
User actions are like normal actions, except they are generated by the CasualOS frontend.
Generally, this only happens for built-in shouts and whispers.
Additionally, these actions can only be automatically created for debuggers that are attached using [`os.attachDebugger(debug, options)`](ref:os.attachDebugger).

tags.text: onBeforeUserAction
debug.onBeforeUserAction

comment.shortText: the function that should be called before a user action is performed.
Registers the given function to be called whenever the debugger is paused by hitting a pause trigger.

tags.text: onPause
debug.onPause

comment.shortText: the function that should be called when the debugger is paused.

Registers the given handler function to be called by the debugger whenever a script enqueues an action.
This occurrs for common actions like [`os.toast(message, duration)`](ref:os.toast) and [`os.showInput(currentValue, options)`](ref:os.showInput).
comment.text: Every action that is enqueued ends up being performed.

comment.shortText: the function that should be called whenever an action is scheduled to be performed.
Performs the given actions in order as if they were user actions.
comment.text: This function works similarly to [`action.perform(action)`](ref:action.perform) except that actions performed with it will also call handlers registered with debug.onBeforeUserAction.

comment.shortText: the actions that should be performed.

Shouts the given events in order until a bot returns a result.
Returns the result that was produced or undefined if no result was produced.
The names of the events to shout.
The argument to shout.
Removes the given pause trigger from the debugger.
the trigger or trigger ID that should be removed from the debugger.
Resumes the debugger execution from the given pause.
the debugger pause that was passed to the handler of debug.onPause.

Asks every bot in the inst to run the given action.
In effect, this is like shouting to a bunch of people in a room.
comment.returns: Returns a list which contains the values returned from each script that was run for the shout.

comment.shortText: The event name.
The optional argument to include in the shout.

Asks the given bots to run the given action.
In effect, this is like whispering to a specific set of people in a room.
comment.returns: Returns a list which contains the values returned from each script that was run for the shout.

comment.shortText: The bot(s) to send the event to.
The name of the event to send.
The optional argument to include.
